text: William Mauldin "Bo" Hopkins (February 2, 1942 â€“ May 28, 2022) was an American actor. He was born in Greenville, South Carolina. His career began in 1966 and he retired in 2020. His best known movie roles were in The Wild Bunch (1969), The Bridge at Remagen (1969), The Getaway (1972), American Graffiti (1973), The Man Who Loved Cat Dancing (1973), The Killer Elite (1975), Posse (1975), A Small Town in Texas (1976), Midnight Express (1978), and More American Graffiti (1979). Hopkins died on May 28, 2022 after having a heart attack nineteen days before in Van Nuys, California at the age of 80. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:Actors from South Carolina Category:People from Greenville, South Carolina
title: Bo Hopkins
